name: SetAllowedActionsForOrganization
description:
Set allowed GitHub Actions for an organization.

This tool sets which GitHub Actions are permitted in an organization, given the organization's permission policy is configured to 'selected'. It requires an access token with the 'admin:org' scope or GitHub App permissions for 'administration'. Use it when you need to update allowed actions based on organization or enterprise policies.

parameters.name: organization_name
parameters.description: The name of the GitHub organization. It is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The organization name. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: allowed_actions_settings
parameters.description: JSON object specifying allowed GitHub-owned actions and patterns for specific actions. Includes 'github_owned_allowed' (boolean) and 'patterns_allowed' (list of string patterns).

github_owned_allowed.description: Whether GitHub-owned actions are allowed. For example, this includes the actions in the `actions` organization.

patterns_allowed.description: Specifies a list of string-matching patterns to allow specific action(s). Wildcards, tags, and SHAs are allowed. For example, `monalisa/octocat@*`, `monalisa/octocat@v2`, `monalisa/*`.
